subject: p11052935
Findings: Heart size is normal. Mediastinal and hilar contours are unremarkable. Pulmonary vascularity is normal. The lungs are hyperinflated with severe emphysema. Punctate calcified granulomas are seen within the lung bases. Linear opacities in the lung bases likely reflect scarring or subsegmental atelectasis. Residual patchy opacity within the left upper lobe likely reflects scarring, as seen on the prior chest CT. No new consolidation, pleural effusion or pneumothorax is identified. Scarring within the lung apices is again noted. There is diffuse demineralization of the osseous structures.
Impression: No acute cardiopulmonary abnormality. Severe emphysema. Residual left upper lobe opacity likely reflects scarring, as seen on the prior chest CT, with bibasilar linear opacities either reflecting subsegmental atelectasis or scarring.
